question.text: With reference to different structures of the human brain, which one is an incorrect match?

options.text: Thalamus : Major co-ordinating centre for sensory and motor signalling.
Association area :Resp onsible for complex functions like intersensory associations, memory and communication.
Medulla oblongata : Controls respiration, cardiovascular reflexes, excitement and urge for eating and drinking.
Limbic system : Alongwith the hypothalamus, it is involved in the regulation of sexual behaviour and expression of emotions.

solution.text: Medulla oblongata of hind brain contains centres which control respiration, cardiovascular reflexes, gastric secretion and vomiting. Hypothalamus of fire brain contains a number of centres which control body temperature, urge for eating and drinking.
